trans-unit.source: Create an iOS app on Azure App Service Mobile Apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create an iOS app on Azure App Service Mobile Apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started with using Azure mobile app backends for iOS development in Objective-C or Swift
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started with using Azure mobile app backends for iOS development in Objective-C or Swift

trans-unit.source: Create an iOS app
trans-unit.target: Create an iOS app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an iOS mobile app by using an Azure mobile app backend.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an iOS mobile app by using an Azure mobile app backend.

trans-unit.source: You will create both a new mobile app backend and a simple _Todo list_ iOS app that stores app data in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You will create both a new mobile app backend and a simple _Todo list_ iOS app that stores app data in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other iOS tutorials about using the Mobile Apps feature in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other iOS tutorials about using the Mobile Apps feature in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile apps that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile apps that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio Community 2013] or a later version.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio Community 2013] or a later version.

trans-unit.source: A Mac with Xcode v7.0 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: A Mac with Xcode v7.0 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before you sign up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>. There, you can immediately create a short-lived starter mobile app in App Service—no credit card required, and no commitments.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before you sign up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>. There, you can immediately create a short-lived starter mobile app in App Service—no credit card required, and no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure mobile app backend
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure mobile app backend

trans-unit.source: Download the server project
trans-unit.target: Download the server project

trans-unit.source: On your PC, visit the [Azure portal].
trans-unit.target: On your PC, visit the [Azure portal].

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All > Mobile Apps, and then click the mobile app backend that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All > Mobile Apps, and then click the mobile app backend that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the Mobile App blade, click Settings, and then under Mobile App, click Quickstart > iOS (Objective-C).
trans-unit.target: In the Mobile App blade, click Settings, and then under Mobile App, click Quickstart > iOS (Objective-C).

trans-unit.source: If you prefer Swift, click Quickstart > iOS (Swift) instead.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer Swift, click Quickstart > iOS (Swift) instead.

trans-unit.source: Under Download and run your server project, click Download.
trans-unit.target: Under Download and run your server project, click Download.

trans-unit.source: Extract the compressed project files to your PC, and open the solution in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Extract the compressed project files to your PC, and open the solution in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Publish the server project to Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish the server project to Azure

trans-unit.source: Download and run the iOS app
trans-unit.target: Download and run the iOS app
